title: Sweet gran accidentally sent her grandson a birthday card with a REALLY insulting message
text:
Sweet gran accidentally sent her grandson a birthday card with a REALLY insulting message 
Mouth artist Henry Fraser posted the rude card on Twitter By Alison Maloney Comments WHAT could be nicer on your birthday than a thoughtful card from your sweet old granny? 
One man thought heâ€™s got just that â€“ until he read the message on the front. Henry got this sweet card from his gran but she clearly didnt see the hidden mesage 

Henry Fraserâ€™s gran clearly thought she was sending a card that spelled out her grandsonâ€™s best qualities â€“ â€œterrific, wonderful, awesome, tremendous.â€ 
She may not have noticed that it actually spelled out something else â€“ â€œT**t.â€ 
Henry, a disabled mouth artist, posted the picture on Twitter. 
He wrote: â€œGot this birthday card from my grandma. The sentiment is beautiful, but she didnâ€™t realise what the card was trying to say!â€ 
The tweet got over 1,500 likes and TV presenter Gabby Logan Tweeted: â€œOh I love it, sheâ€™ll be mortified. Happy Birthday.â€ 
Henry, 25, confirmed his grannyâ€™s insult was unintentional. 
He Tweeted: â€œIt made my day! I wouldnâ€™t have the heart to tell her.â€ Instagram Henry said his grans card made his day RELATED STORIES 'I'm practising your sex tape' From unexpected overshares to hilarious autocorrect fails, these are the funniest text messages sent by grandparents 'Like Cher without botox' Cruel Jeremy Kyle fans troll female guest with a vile stream of insults 'I PUT IT ON MY CV' Card-shark maths student funds himself through uni with cash won in poker tournaments - and was earning Â£20,000 a year at the age of just 15 'We moved 3,000 miles to make our son a millionaireâ€™ Lad set up his own social network at 12 after dad banned him from Facebook â€“ and is now worth Â£40million at 15 Is your town on the list? Sarah Beeny reveals 50 best places to live in the UK in new show ... you'll never guess the winner 
Gabby replied: â€œNo you shouldnâ€™t tell herâ€¦letâ€™s hope none of her mates follow you on Twitter.â€ 
Henry started painting with his mouth after being paralysed from the shoulders down in a diving accident in 2009. 
The former rugby playerâ€™s art works include self-portraits and a painting of former England captain Chris Robshaw. Got this birthday card from my grandma. The sentiment is beautiful, but she didn't realise what the card was trying to say! ğŸ™ˆğŸ˜‚ pic.twitter.com/QbBFaj5d1C
